rationale: The version field exists in the target but not in the source schema.
The description field exists in the target but not in the source schema.
parent_sample_id in the target describes the sample, not the donor.
Both schemas use donor_id to identify the HuBMAP Display ID of the donor of the assayed tissue.
There is no tissue_id field in the target schema.
No equivalent of execution_datetime exists in the target schema.
Both fields represent a DOI for a protocol, but preparation_protocol_doi is more specific to sample preparation in the target schema.
The operator field is missing from the target schema.
No matching operator_email field exists in the target schema.
No pi field in the target schema.
No matching pi_email field in the target schema.
The assay_category in the source is a broader concept that categorizes the type of data, while dataset_type in the target is more specific to the type of dataset being produced.
The assay_type in the source schema refers to the specific type of assay (e.g., CODEX), while dataset_type in the target schema is a broader classification of dataset types.
Both schemas use analyte_class to describe the target molecules being measured.
Both fields specify whether a specific molecule(s) is/are targeted.
Both fields describe the vendor of the acquisition instrument.
Both schemas use the field to describe the model of the acquisition instrument.
No corresponding fields for resolution values in the target schema.
No corresponding fields for resolution values in the target schema.
No corresponding fields for resolution values in the target schema.
Both fields describe the vendor of the preparation instrument.
Both schemas use the field to describe the model of the preparation instrument.
Both schemas capture the number of antibodies used in the assay.
Both schemas capture the number of channels.
Both fields refer to cycles/rounds of the assay, but number_of_cycles is a broader concept in the source, while number_of_biomarker_imaging_rounds refers to specific imaging rounds in the target.
Both refer to a DOI for protocols.io, but the preparation_protocol_doi in the target is specific to preparation, while section_prep_protocols_io_doi includes section preparation in the source.
Both refer to a DOI for protocols.io, but the preparation_protocol_doi in the target is specific to preparation, while reagent_prep_protocols_io_doi refers to reagent preparation in the source.
Both fields refer to the relative path to the antibody file.
Both fields refer to the path to the contributors file.
Both fields refer to the relative path to the data directory or file.
